intro: Bupleurum subfalcatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branching stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic common in the Apiaceae family. Bupleurum subfalcatum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
